website_summaries.verdict: It costs more than you might expect for a manual machine, but the quality, accuracy and reliability is hard to beat.
pros: Very accurate and easy to use
A lifetime warranty just makes this more appealing
cons: Very expensive for a manual machine

customer_reviews.title: It's all about the YARN!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd project on the Addi King... Took me about 2 hours for both hat and scarf. I used Caron Simply Soft Yarn. ITS ALL ABOUT THE YARN FOLKS!! This yarn is very easy on the Addi!!
customer_reviews.author: Ilene Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Follow the instructions for a quick,quality project.
customer_reviews.text: Several reviews gave less stars because they experienced dropped stitches, however, I believe these reviewers may have neglected to read the instructions prior to trying their machines. It takes some practice but, read and follow the instructions carefully; hold the yarn taunt, turn the handle at a moderate speed, carefully watch for potential errors to be able to fix immediately, and DO NOT try to back up. The results will be a perfectly knitted project in a fraction of the time that it takes to hand knit. If you do all this and have repeated problems, you may have received a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Burkhalter

customer_reviews.title: There is definitely a learning curve to using an addi ...
customer_reviews.text: There is definitely a learning curve to using an addi Express. I also have a Bond Ultimate Sweater knitter and wish there were more ways to customize the stitches on the addi. However, for quick knitting scarves and hats, this will do the trick. I agree with other reviewers that the row counter isn't always accurate, which is unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kovanda

customer_reviews.title: Addi review
customer_reviews.text: There was a learning curve with this machine but once you get the hang of it it does a pretty good job occasionally skips stitches and you have to start all over again because I can't fix them LOL I'm trying to learn that but all in all I would purchase again You really can make a simple hat in 20 to 30 minutes I have had my Addie almost a month and I have made about 18 hats for various sizes and one scarf. Watching YouTube videos was very helpful before and after I got it
customer_reviews.author: Deborah from Old Fort NC

customer_reviews.title: Knitting Machine
customer_reviews.text: I have broken some of the knitting needles in my machine but my husband has been able to replace them when needed. The needles are kind of expensive. I have knitted a large number of hats on this machine and found that a medium thread works best. You do need to keep an eye on it so you don't drop a stitch. Over all I love it because it saves a lot of time. I can made a hat in about 15 mins. I also have the baby Express and love it for making baby hats and scarves.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Stop talking yourself out of it and JUST BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: I'm a maker that sews and crochets; I debated about purchasing this for myself for awhile, not due to financial reasons, but because I wondered if I REALLY needed this thing. I finally did and WOW! The Addi lives up to the hype! Its so fun and easy to use. Side note: if you are first learning to use it and get discouraged due to dropped stitches or other troubleshooting issues, there are plenty of YouTube videos to assist you. The type of yarn you use is important!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: I Love My Addi
customer_reviews.text: I love my Addi! I received it for Christmas and have made 30 scarves and 20 hats in a month. So much fun. Great service from seller!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Fun machine.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great if you use compatible yarns. It might take a little experimenting to find yarns that work well with it. I found out the hard way that it doesn't like cotton yarn (too much friction), but it works wonderful with smooth, worsted weight wool. It works best at knitting tubes. It can make flat panels, but knitting them is a bit more complicated. It knits in minutes what normally takes hours. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Skywatcher

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful investment
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around for over a year. I didn’t want to spend so much money on a circular knitting machine. I wish I bought it last year! What a wonderful product, I had the generic China one and I will tell you that they are like night and day. This machine is fast. It hardly ever drops a stitch. I can make a hat in 30 minutes and a matching scarf in a little over an hour. Best investment ever!! Five stars all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Gray

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't know if it is easy to use as I had to return it twice. The first was missing 2 legs, the second had 0 legs and 0 clamps for the table. Not sure if it was the seller or the Amazon fulfillment center but either way I wasn't about to deal with it a 3rd time.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Flythe

customer_reviews.title: Knits beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: I’m thrilled with this machine! I only had to watch a YouTube video from The Crochet Crowd & I was off to a great start. The machine is easy to use and knits beautifully. I’m going to make a lot of Christmas gifts with this! 🧶 🧶 🧶
customer_reviews.author: Stellar Starshine

customer_reviews.title: You have to be patient.
customer_reviews.text: I have a flat bed knitting machine (one of the old Incredible Sweater Machines) that I have spent hours and hours using. I think that experience helped me a lot getting the hang of this. Understanding the cast on, cast off, dropped stitches, etc. People new to machine knitting should definitely hit youtube for some instructional videos. A little time and patience makes all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Nazu

customer_reviews.title: I'm still getting to know this machine
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy. The instructions are clear and concise. The machine does what it was built to do. I got this for two reasons. First to knit blanks for dyeing. I can hold together two or three strands of fingering weight yarn to get a blank that will give me skeins that match (or at least go together). I also thought I could use the machine to quickly use up bits of yarn from other projects and make hats. I'm still sorting out what weight works best. So far I think that is in the aran, chunky, bulky range. Bottom line: easy to get started using, may take some time to figure out what works for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly's Creek

customer_reviews.title: I had a terrible experince with it
customer_reviews.text: I had been watching on you tube about this knitting machine and watched people use it so I ordered me one WELL for 3 days I tried to use it and did everything the reviews said to do BUT every time there would be 3 stitches in the center that would drop off. It got on my nerves so bad I sent it back for a refund. Terrible machine for the money it cost. I made 1 hat that looked ok, but that is all I could get. I wanted it to make burial blankets for a hospital, but could never get the flat panel to work.
customer_reviews.author: Edna Tollison

customer_reviews.title: May have been used and advertised as firsthand.
customer_reviews.text: Very upset that it was so expensive and that it worked 3/4 of the time and and never perfectly. Most of all it takes forever to be delivered with PRIME shipping and I waited all day for delivery 🚚 📦 I thought it was cast on human error and later realized that it was not in pristine shape it may have been used or second hand and I didn’t realize it. Lots of random slipped stitch and all 3 black hooks 45&46 are unpredictable and sticks and the 4 or 5 hooks adjacent to 45&46 snag and drop stitches mid pattern. Not relaxing to use so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: F. F. F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my intended use
customer_reviews.text: Although shipping from Germany was slow, the product arrived in perfect condition. I made my first hat sucessfully the first time I tried it. I’m now able to make a hat in about 20 minutes, including setup, weaving in ends, etc. I had hoped to use up my excess worsted yarn by making hats for the homeless. Although one hat was too light weight for warmth, I’m using slightly thicker yarn now (occasionally two thinner yarns held together), and having so much fun that I’ve (unfortunately) started buying yarn just to make more hats. Using this is a great break between more “serious” projects. Easy to learn, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Flamingo Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very smooth turning machine. It has good heft, but it's not heavy. The feet actually screw in and that's a plus. And they have rubber pads on the bottoms. The clamps that come with it help hold it very secure. I started a hat right away and it's fantastic! I watch Margaret Oleander of Sheepishly Sharing and she is 100% correct about this machine! You will not be disappointed. It got toe really fast and there were a few extras in it too. I just received it a few hours ago. I will update again later.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Fricke

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy this machine, but a few comments...
customer_reviews.text: The Addi knitting machine is very well constructed of hard and sturdy plastic. (With help from Youtube), it was easy to set up and use immediately. Casting on, knitting, and binding off are a breeze.The crank is well positioned and comfortable to use . This machine is excellent for making scarves, hats, and any item that is tube or flat panel shape. I am a little disappointed in the weight of yarn it uses. Although it is supposed to take #4 weight, many of the heavier #4's won't work. Overall, it is easy to use and knits quickly.
customer_reviews.author: K. Obrien

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box. I have an Addi pro before this one, so i have used it for over a month and experimented with yarns and patterns on it. There are so many video tutorials, I recommend watching them!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Has never worked correct!
customer_reviews.text: Should have returned but thought I was doing something wrong. Not so! Found out from others it just don’t work. Would love it if it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Aggies Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the inexperienced and experienced knitters alike.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great product! I never learned how to knit by hand, but desired to do so. I am still planning to learn, but until then, i can use this machine. After I learn, I will probably still use it when I need multiple items faster. I struggle with the machine dropping a stitch. I sometimes move too fast I think. Once I drop a stitch.... I don't know what to do to fix it.... I don't think I can do anything unless I catch it right away or nearly right away. Still a good investment. I sold a hat that I made with it and gave some away as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Schlamp

customer_reviews.title: I'm so happy I finally got this I had so much fun ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I finally got this I had so much fun working on it! It has a lot of potential for a lot of projects. Shipping was quick too! Thank you so much!!
customer_reviews.author: stefania

customer_reviews.title: Maintenance
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, I make hats from 'recycled' afghans and take they are given to the needy. Two things I've noted, one, if the yarn is 'scratchy' the machine has trouble with it, and two, it needs to be cleaned occasionally because yarn fuzz accumulates inside the needles and slows the machine down. If you are using 'new' yarn, it doesn't do these things. I would recommend the Addi to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Love the machine for the idea but the craftsmanship is not very good had mine for about three weeks made about 150 hats and now the machine is skipping stitches and the handle is broken
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Best machine ever!
customer_reviews.text: Addi makes the best circular knitting machines available. I'm having no problems at all, and when I need help, there are plenty of videos on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Studio T

customer_reviews.title: Craft Fair Approved
customer_reviews.text: Glad I got this thing on sale. I've made about 60 hats and scarves and I'm in love. My son even can use this thing and he's 7. Only issue I've had is certain Yarns do split so you have to watch it very closely.
customer_reviews.author: LadiesWhoLunch

customer_reviews.title: Birthday present success
customer_reviews.text: Got this for daughter's 30th birthday. She is not especially crafty and could not get the hang of crochet or knitting by hand. All of a sudden, she is turning out this terrific and professional-looking stuff! She made knit hats and was able to incorporate patterns, shrugs, scarves. Her sister's gift hat was literally purchased right off her head by a friend who insisted on having it. Knitting daughter was so pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. Although it was a little pricey, I saved up my money and purchased it. Now I'm experimenting with different weights of yarn. It's true I made a hat within 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Chapman

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I love love LOVE this machine! It has surpassed my expectations! It is so much fun to use, and the possibilities are endless! Nicely made and have had 0 problems with it. Making a sweater (Matterhorn from Ravelry) with it now! I ordered the smaller version not long after getting this one.
customer_reviews.author: AmentLVR

customer_reviews.title: Broken after under 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Super annoyed. I've had my machine for under 2 months and it's broken already. I'm disappointed that I used it maybe 10 times and it's trashed. I purchased this product from Rose&Woman and am currently waiting on response from them about a warranty. Unfortunately the machine is Broken but the company has made it right and I appreciate there help
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable strong, easy to use, and so very versatile machine
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god, what a machine! The very first day I cranked out three beautiful hats and I don’t know how to knit or crochet!!! This is so easy to operate and there is everything you need to know free on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE! False advertising ! The shop owner claims that This particular model has the following features: 46 needles, needle holder, decrease needle, 5 replacement needles, 4 basefeet, 2 screw hooks for stable table mounting, digital row counter with memory function.( this is wrong mine came with the old analog counter. Old stock) Knitting Properties: suitable for yarn count 4-8, circular knitting: approx. 10 inch to 15 inch diameter, flat knitting: approx. 18 inch wide
customer_reviews.author: Amy Durrwachter

customer_reviews.title: Love my Addi!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Addi knitting machine. I have wrist pain so traditional knitting isn’t something I can do anymore. This have given me back my ability to make knitted hats, ear warmers & a bunch if other things. After using it for a month i bought the other 2 sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Mom life!

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my add express king size! It arrived sooner than expected and in perfect condition. I have made several scarves and hats. It was worth every penny. Very easy to use. Just a little tip, if you want a clean edge for whatever you're making try casting off your stitches with double pointed needles. It takes a little more time, but it looks beautiful. Now I want the smaller addi too! Darcy
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: Getting what I ordered.  This was not
customer_reviews.text: This item should of had a digital counter but it replace with a clicking device. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy J.

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic product. It can make a hat under 30 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product. It can make a hat under 30 minutes. The product arrived ahead of time and packaged in a heavy duty box very well. I'm making hats and scarfs for the homeless and has served me very well.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Addi King
customer_reviews.text: I find this to be a nice alternative to hand knitting. The downside is that you are limited in size of hat it produces but it is snuggly warm and a hat can be made start to finish in about 45 minutes. I wish they would come out with a slightly larger one.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper Martino

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - Choose quality yarns
customer_reviews.text: This machine is worth the money. It makes beautiful stitches. I learned to hold the yarn as it feeds through the machine to keep a good tension. Every yarn I used worked beautifully with the exception of red heart super saver ombré. It did not work up evenly at all compared to other yarns. See the third picture in my review. The red heart is on the right and didn’t not work well. Other than that I am completely satisfied with this machine as I typically use yarn from hobby lobby anyways and those all worked up beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Broken parts!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted an Addi for years. I was so excited when this one arrived. Then I set it up and realized one of the legs would not screw in and the machine had a hard click on the third black needle. The machine also seemed to have been previously used. I am returning it. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Diedre L. Mathis

customer_reviews.title: View videos before you get frustrated.
customer_reviews.text: This machine is great for hats and scarves which I make for the homeless. It is easier to use than other machine brands I have owned but there is a bit of a learning curve. Great videos are available to help online.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pohll

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great machine and great customer service. Well worth the wait since the machine shipped from Germany. Having a blast making hats, scarves and baby blankets. Real easy to setup and very user friendly. The directions are easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says and last
customer_reviews.text: I really don't like writing a review on something like this to I use it for couple months. But so far it's holding up, working great. Excellent and I hope it stays that way. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: grace humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Great Machine. Very easy to use even if you've never knitted before you can be a pro in minutes! Has really eased the burden of my knitting and so far I have made over a 100 knits in just a week so if you love knitting, you definitely need this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: This is my 2nd one because we wore the first one out!!! These machines couldn't be ANY better!
customer_reviews.text: The Addi Express creates the perfect cap and you may choose what type of yarn and how long it is. You can use separate utensils to create pom-poms and there are so many different ideas on pinterest that you'll never have a difficult time creating something special!
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: No regrets, now I need to buy the small one too!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think that there are any other machines out there that compare. There is a newer model that has an improved row counter but I’ve never had any issues with mine (although I don’t always need to use it). I just knitted on it a 1 pound roll of yarn without any assistance (other than cranking and feeding yarn obviously) it produced a tube with zero mistakes! Just don’t turn the crank with the yarn guide open, it catches the needles.
customer_reviews.author: happenstantials

customer_reviews.title: The machine was easy to set up straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The Addi Express King Size arrived March 30th (shipped March 9th). So far I have no complains. I’m impressed by how fast I can make a hat now. I haven’t done any flat panels yet but that will be next on my agenda. The machine was easy to set up straight out of the box. Since I was already accustomed to loom knitting it was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Petra LaForest

customer_reviews.title: Addi King Size Knitting Machine
customer_reviews.text: The Addi does a nice job on circular knitting. There is a short learning curve for using it, but with the help of all the videos on line, problems are quickly identified and corrected. The machine seems to be well made. Although I have had it for a very short time I can say that I have already finished my first project.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of research to find a good lasting machine to make hats. This was it. Awesome machine and I couldn't be happier. I have some of the cheaper machines and this handles much better than they do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I think this was a rip off I’m never trusting another product from them . The machine keeps skipping and dropping stitches. Also the handle keeps coming off after about 20 rows the handle comes off in my hand .I feel like I was sold a bad machine and this is not acceptable. Please don’t waste your money on this
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: No Directions In English!
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it yet. Just unpacked it. Outside the box descriptions all in English. Open the instruction book any every page in German! A little annoyed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good price, and great using Prime Delivery
customer_reviews.text: Every Addi Express likes different brands of yarn. I had to use a few different brands of yarn to see what worked best on my new Addi Express Kingsize. Love this machine very east to use.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Phillips

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product, easy to use, you get great results, and knitting works up so quickly! The customer service was Excellent, arrived on time, and as described! Would order from them again!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knitting in a Jiffy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying my product came sooner than expected, so thank you! Pros: -Easy to use, -Great for making projects fast (hats especially), -Lightweight, -easy too store-Fun to use, and easy for beginners. Cons: Hooks break easily, the stitch drops continuously when making flat panels and even though the instructions say any thickness yarn is ok.... I wouldn't go too thick it will break the hooks. The machine seems to be made of cheap plastic personally it's not worth $198. All in all I don't regret my purchase my 15 y/o old loves it, we've had the Addi for about 3 weeks and she's made 12 hats so far.....so it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: gina

customer_reviews.title: Was so excited, but now so disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this and start my projects, but on the 4th hat the handle broke. The black bracket w.the screw holding the round wheel on the handle in place, just snapped off, why I've no idea. It's very difficult and slow going trying to turn the handle w/o the wheel attached. Not sure if I can fix it or not. The black piece is held by a screw, however it is extremely short as well as small and not sure if I can find a longer screw, regardless very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing instructions - lack of YouTube clips in English. Overall disappoints (it’s German - why are they using plastic needles?) The price is stupid compared to a lower quality that produces the same output. Seriously sh*t product.
customer_reviews.author: D R Hinshaw

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Tried a much ‘less expensive’ product, wasted time and effort with it. The Addi is easy, works beautifully, and glad I spent the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: bev

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item the day after it arrived. It's cheaply made, flimsy and does not run smoothly at all. I've used $20 machines from Walmart that function far better.
customer_reviews.author: annemarie

customer_reviews.title: So far I have enjoyed the use of the addi-express king size
customer_reviews.text: So far I have enjoyed the use of the addi-express king size. I am glad I got the king size as it is able to do everything I have attempted so far. I have made a few hats with ease. It was worth the money I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Tina F.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use I knit for Charities so I can get my hats done quicker
customer_reviews.author: Joanie Hansford

customer_reviews.title: The addi king size knitting machine is a marvel.
customer_reviews.text: certain yarns don't work so well on the addi king, the stitch counter is a manual hand turner and not automatic as I thought, The addi king is not to difficult to use I made several types of hats, scarves and fingerless gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. V

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this thing like crazy. I need to clean it because the gears have started slipping on heavier yarns, but it’s because I’ve used it so much. Worth every dime!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hogan

customer_reviews.title: This machine is perfect, in 10 minutes I make a headband
customer_reviews.text: This machine is perfect, in 10 minutes I make a headband, in 30 minutes I make a hat doubled, it's fantastic! Only small flaw, do not take all kinds of woolen, but really very practical!
customer_reviews.author: cioce nadia

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, easy to learn, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine, there is so much that can be created from clothing, to toys, to household items, it’s a great price and is solid and well built.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S.

customer_reviews.title: It's uncomplicated
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I'm able to do a lot of Charity knitting making hats. Best investment I've made in a long time
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Furline

customer_reviews.title: It works but very finicky.
customer_reviews.text: The needles break very easily! Stitches drop! Not worth the money at all. Update: you have to use the right yarn.
customer_reviews.author: MariaSimone

customer_reviews.title: Wife Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Wife says it's awesome! Great quality and produces awesome results. So much better than cheaper knockoffs!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love making my hats on my new Addi Express King ...
customer_reviews.text: I love making my hats on my new Addi Express King size. The worst part was waiting a month to get it, but I am very satisfied with the quality and the results I am receiving with every personalized hat I have made. I can't wait to try other patterns for the flat pieces like scarves etc.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Nice knitting machine. Easy to use. Makes beautiful professional looking hats.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: The Knitting Machine to buy
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several knitting machines in the past and this one is the best by far. Easy set up and easy to learn. I would highly recommend. The product arrived ahead of schedule. Even though it takes some time to get here (US) from Germany it is well worth the wait. I wish I would have ordered it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. However not all yarn works well with machine, never the less the work comes out lovely!
customer_reviews.author: MOONSTONECHICKEN

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine and despite being made out of cheap-feelng ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine and despite being made out of cheap-feelng plastic, it's a workhorse. I bought mine for around $250 but I think it's considerably cheaper now if you shop around (more like $125).
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Daughter uses the addi Express daily!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this product. Although there were several adjustments with cranking and settings, after watching YouTube it is working to her satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: loyal67

customer_reviews.title: Addi Express just the knitting ticket for your projects!
customer_reviews.text: Addi Express king-sized is a very nice machine to work with it will take you a little while to get the rhythm when first starting do not rush time in the beginning is critical you don't want to lose stitches or drop them then you have a mess on your hands. However I do recommend this highly this is my second knitting machine I have a flatbed and that works beautifully so jump right in and knit to your hearts content.💗👌😃✔
customer_reviews.author: nornieg

customer_reviews.title: Happy Wife!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife. She loves it! Works much better then the cheaper knock off that she was using that kept dropping stitches. The counter actually works too.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up and I started using it right ...
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up and I started using it right away. There are lots of videos on YouTube that will give ideas and suggestions for the common problems that arise. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Falaschi

customer_reviews.title: More expense than other but much better
customer_reviews.text: It was a harder to turn at first but it got better with use. It was cheaper getting it from Germany. Took longer but better price. Its a very well built unit and the work that comes off of it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: DAB

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. Still figuring out which yarn works best. Sometimes you just want to crank out a quick hat or scarf and this fits the bill. I'm going to keep my needles and looms but so happy this has been added to my craft room.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for plain knitting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be able to make hats for kids. It is perfect for that. I haven’t tried anything else yet but I’m sure I will get plenty of use from this little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Makes knitting so easy. I’ve made hats, scarves, and I’m learning how to make a sweater.
customer_reviews.author: aepdx

customer_reviews.title: What a dissapointment!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these, now, and they are both going back! They skipped stitches like crazy. The "needles" clicked and popped and snagged, for lack of better terms. I was so excited to get this machine and can't believe how badly it operates!
customer_reviews.author: GREGORY K HANNA

customer_reviews.title: It's great for people with Arthritis
customer_reviews.text: I love the Addi. After I watched YouTube using the Addi became a lot easier. The one thing I didn't like was the box came in damaged. The Addi is so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Shelly George

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This was a longed for birthday gift, Have been wanting this for a long time. Now I have it and wish I had bought it long ago. Love the addi Express so much for Christmas will be receiving the small one to. Highly recommend you buy a Black & Decker WM125 Workmate 125 350-Pound Capacity Portable Work Bench, it fits it perfectly and your projects drop between the slats pefectly. This machine is made so well and works so quietly and well. Almost finished several gifts already.
customer_reviews.author: DigitalPommieTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. Had 10 Christmas gifts ready in just two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah R. Cota

customer_reviews.title: It is different than regular knitting
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Gets basic projects done fast. Cons: You can't fix mistakes easily, so be prepared to have to start over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Great product - works as good as advertised. Shipping took a bit longer than expected, but it went from Germany to the US to Japan - just takes awhile when sent general delivery. I would recommend this to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Addi king express
customer_reviews.text: Great performance , good value . Wish yarn would come with it. Wish there was a good recommended ones to try . It appears to me that the yarns for me that had a. Tight twist to it worked out the best. This is my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: dreuter48

customer_reviews.title: Love My Addi!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! It was delivered Monday and I have made 30 hats already. I make the hats for Chemo patients at two different hospitals and homeless shelters. TheAddi is fast and easy on the fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Snow

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely adore my Addi! I’ve only had this ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely adore my Addi! I’ve only had this since Feb 3rd, 2018 Ive made over 35 hats. My family loves the hats I’ve gifted. I’ve started a local hat donation program at our elemtary schools, hats for children.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Makes knitting as a hobby and for profit easier
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Arthritis in my hands makes almost any handmade craft work nearly impossible. This is my first completed project. :) UPDATE: I mounted mine on an old shelving board so I could use it from the couch or in bed. Left handed users may find it easier to use if it's placed/mounted with the crank wheel facing you and the digital counter facing left. You'll have a good view of the needles to ensure the yarn catches properly and the crank will be closer.
customer_reviews.author: LastStarNtheSky

customer_reviews.title: I've only done flat panels on this so far, ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only done flat panels on this so far, but it has sped up my work 10 fold. This is expensive, but so worth the time it saves.
customer_reviews.author: fortheloveofphoto

customer_reviews.title: Best investment in a knitting machine so far.
customer_reviews.text: Love how quick I can knit hats and scarves since I donate them to local shelters
customer_reviews.author: a.stewart

customer_reviews.title: Addie knitter
customer_reviews.text: This is a good circular knitter for hats. I have not tried flat panels yet. I would like it better if it didn't drop stitches so often making it necessary to start over.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: full refund please
customer_reviews.text: I would like a full refund for this item. I was unhappy with it. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer right here! I absolutely love this machine! I have ordered the adapter off of ebay to go with it and made 9 hats in 1 day!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Knitting Machine!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have made in a long time! Uncomplicated ab nd turns out a great fabric!
customer_reviews.author: Carol the Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: I love it and its in working good order
customer_reviews.text: I love it and its in working good order. Please do your research before buying the machine. Please watch youtube videos on the kingsize addi. It will help a lot. For a beginner of doing basic sewing required and it takes patient.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa32

customer_reviews.title: Addi knitting machine
customer_reviews.text: I like the Addi knitting machine. However, I’m learning that not all size yarns work well in the knitting machine. Certain size yarns have too many drop stitching
customer_reviews.author: Ardy Lemelle

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Device at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality instructions, a lot of online help for ways to do any kind of weaving on the device
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Aquino

customer_reviews.title: Talk about fast!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, wow, wow. Talk about fast! The only issue is learning how much tension to put on the yarn, but no other complaints!
customer_reviews.author: pinecats

customer_reviews.title: Good quality ❤
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine, I made a lot of beanies & scarfs
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Ritterbush

product_meta.title: Addi Express King Size Knitting Machine
product_meta.description: Style Name:King SizeMore possibilities, larger items - and even more knitting fun. That is what you get with the addi-Express King-size. With its larger diameter you can do even more individual knitting with just a few turns of the hand. Like the addi-Express the King-size clamps to the table so that it won't slip. The yarn can be inserted easily into the circle - and off you go.
feature_bullets: Knitting fun at lightning speed, winding instead of knitting. Easy and fast
46 Needles & electronic row counter and contains 5 replacement pins, 1 threading tool and 4 feel 2 clampers
Designed and built in Germany to exacting standards and using finest materials available. and Circular knitted items approx. 35cm
Plain knitted items up to 45cm wide
Recommended yarn thickness 3. 5mm to 8mm (DK to super chunky)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars781 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Addi stopper, spare needles, feet, clamps
